name: Super 8 Stamford/New York City Area

reviews.text: I will start by saying that this hotel was decent enough for a one night stay. It was fairly clean, and seemed secure enough. But in reality it looked like a truck stop motel. It is right off an I-95 exit ramp in an industrial area of Stamford. There are little to no facilities in the hotel, the front desk staff seemed indifferent and spoke choppy English. The room was large enough, but bland and stunk of smoke( even though it was non-smoking). The bottom line here is that this hotel cost me almost 100 a night, and for the price what you get is a joke. This hotel should be no more then 60 a night. I know Fairfield county is expensive, but this hotel was just off the highway in a rather rundown area of town. They should not be overcharging like the rest of the area hotels. Overall this is a lousy value, even for a Super 8.
reviews.title: Way , Way overpriced.

reviews.text: I stayed here in december 2005, it was ok. The room itself was clean but the bathroom was moldy. The bed was not comfortable, but the price was about $40.00 less than other hotels in area.
reviews.title: It was ok
Clean - but overpriced and not a good overall value
reviews.text: Stayed here in july 2004-- the motel has its good and bad points; there is a computer w/ hi-speed internet in the lobby which is good; has a shuttle to the train station to get to NYC; but it doesn't have a pool and also it is a little pricey (70-85 bucks/night) for a super 8. The beds are very uncomfortable. On the flip side, it is in a nice area and it is very clean and the staff is friendly. That said, you can do better for $70.

aka: Super 8 Stamford/New York City Area Hotel Stamford
